page.title: 18JOBS IN TARRANT VALLEY
page.content: Because our block is mainly farmland we guessed that most people who worked would be connected in some way or other to agriculture.An old man we talked to said that 50 years ago nearly everyone in the houses or cottages was a farm worker but that this had changed.Machines had taken over so fewer men were needed.Of the people we asked about half were working on farms,a lot worked in offices or factories in Blandford, Wimborne & Poole while 1 person went to London to work in an office and only came home at weekends.Six people worked at the Langton Arms public house and and at the Crown in Tarrant Hinton.There was one author,a post man and a director of a big firm. There were also lots of retired people especially in Tarrant Monkton.
